Info.title: How to Make a Simple REST Api using React, Spring Boot and H2
Info.desc: The first part explains how to initialize a Spring Boot project in VSCode.

Instructions.instruction: BEFORE YOU DO ANY OF THIS, go to the &Create a Project Templates Folder&[TemplatesLink] link above and complete all the instructions if you haven't done so already. After you do that, run the following command in your terminal to create new vue project. It will be named "react-spring-frontend" and will be created in your top-most directory.
First, make sure you have all the following programs installed by running the following commands. If the commands output a version, you're good.

Code.FormatCode:
java --version
brew --version
mvn --version
ls /Applications | grep "Visual Studio Code"
Code.CopyCode:
java --version
brew --version
mvn --version
ls /Applications | grep "Visual Studio Code"

Instructions.instruction: Make sure the "java --version" command outputs version 17-something. You can download it [here](https://www.oracle.com/java/technologies/downloads/#jdk17-mac) if you don't already installed. Make sure to choose the right version for your OS and architecture. Run the following command to determine your architecture. When you're back on the site, choose the DMG installer. Then click on the download button and then follow the prompts.
Now go to your terminal and run the following command. We're going to set your Java version to 17. Note that this process is different for bash.
In your nano file paste the two following lines. You shouldn't have to modify them.
To save the changes, press control + o. Then press return/enter. Then press control + x.
Open a completely new terminal and run the following command. It should output Java 17.0.6 (Or 17 something).
After you have Java 17 installed, delete the archive that contains the installation files.
If you don't already have Visual Studio Code downloaded, install it by going to this [link](https://code.visualstudio.com/download). Make sure to choose the correct version for your OS.
If you don't already have homebrew installed, run the following commands.
If you don't have maven installed, run the following command. Then check that it was installed properly using the "mvn --version" command. NOTE: This may take a minute or two.
Most of the following steps come from this [video](https://youtu.be/L5QXRoTtPr4?si=yvs4scL-HG2y1R0Z&t=115). You might find watching what's happening to be helpful.

First install the necessary VSCode extensions using the following links. Press the green "Install" button, then when it takes you to VSCode press the blue "Install" button.

Ext 1: [Extension Pack for Java](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscjava.vscode-java-pack)
Ext 2: [Spring Initializr Java Support](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscjava.vscode-spring-initializr)
Ext 3: [Spring Boot Dashboard](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vscjava.vscode-spring-boot-dashboard)
Ext 4: [Spring Boot Tools](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vmware.vscode-spring-boot)
Ext 5: [Spring Boot Extension Pack](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=vmware.vscode-boot-dev-pack)
After you've installed those extensions, do the following steps in VSCode.

Code.FormatCode:
Steps
 1. command + shift + p (Open command pallette)
 2. Search and press on "Welcome: Open Walkthrough..."
 3. Then search/press on "Getting Started with Spring Boot in VS Code"
 4. You should be taken to a new tab after that.
Code.CopyCode:
Steps
1. command + shift + p (Open command pallette)
2. Search and press on "Welcome: Open Walkthrough..."
3. Then search and press on "Getting Started with Spring Boot in VS Code"
4. You should be taken to a new tab after that.

Instructions.instruction: Under "Start with a Spring Boot project" press on the blue "Create New Project" button. A command pallette should then open. If you need to close it later use the "esc" key.
In the new command pallette, search and press on the following options in the following order.

Code.FormatCode:
Spring Boot Version: 3.3.1 (Or First Option/Does NOT include "Snapshot")
Project Language: Java
Group Id: com.springbackend
Artifact Id: demo
Packaging Type: Jar
Java Version: 17
Dependendices: Spring Web and Lombok (Search separately)

Press Enter/Return
Press "Generate into this folder"
Press "Open" in the VSCode pop-up
Say "Yes, I trust the authors" if prompted
Code.CopyCode:
Spring Boot Version: 3.3.1 (Or First Option/Does NOT include "Snapshot")
Project Language: Java
Group Id: com.springbackend
Artifact Id: demo
Packaging Type: Jar
Java Version: 17
Dependendices: Spring Web and Lombok (Search separately)

Press Enter/Return
Press "Generate into this folder"
Press "Open" in the VSCode pop-up
Say "Yes, I trust the authors" if prompted

Info.title: Create the REST API for this project
Info.desc: Explains how to write the code for the Rest API and then run it.

Instructions.instruction: Now open a new terminal and run the following command. It will rename your project to be "spring-boot-h2". You should be in your root directory when you run this command.

Run the following commands to crate new folders/files in your project. Instead of using the "touch" commands, I'd recommend just right clicking on folders in VSCode and press "New file" for Java files. It will auto-generate packages and boiler-plate code for the file. I just included the "touch" commands because I thought they'd be convenient and I've included the necessary code below.

Code.FormatCode:
cd spring-boot-h2/src/main/java/com/springbackend/demo

mkdir config
mkdir controllers
mkdir models
mkdir repositories
mkdir services

touch config/WebConfig.java
touch config/H2ServerConfiguration.java
touch controllers/UserController.java
touch models/User.java
touch repositories/UserRepository.java
touch services/UserService.java

cd ~/spring-boot-h2
touch system.properties
touch .env
clear
Code.CopyCode:
cd spring-boot-h2/src/main/java/com/springbackend/demo

mkdir config
mkdir controllers
mkdir models
mkdir repositories
mkdir services

touch config/WebConfig.java
touch config/H2ServerConfiguration.java
touch controllers/UserController.java
touch models/User.java
touch repositories/UserRepository.java
touch services/UserService.java

cd ~/spring-boot-h2
touch system.properties
touch .env
clear

Instructions.instruction: Just for future reference, you can go to [Maven Central](https://central.sonatype.com/?smo=true) to search for new Maven dependencies or to verify that the dependencies you're using actually exist.

Now open your "spring-boot-h2" folder in VSCode. Then open "pom.xml" and paste the following data in between the <dependencies> tags. Paste the data at the end of the section, which should be around line 47. Make sure to paste it above the last </dependencies> tag. Put your cursor at the very beginning of the line, then paste the data to make it align with the other objects (it will still work if the alignment is off). @Relevant Meme@[{ 'name': 'ImageView', 'params': { 'Name': 'Pom.xml CLI tool when? ðŸ‘€', 'Description': 'Do you have any idea how lit it would be if you could actually do this', 'Pic': 'pom.jpg'} }].

Now press "command + p". Search for and press on "application.properties". Delete the files contents and paste the following values into the file. If you can't find "application.properties" it can be found in src -> main -> resources.

Code.FormatCode:
spring.application.name=demo
logging.level.root=OFF
logging.level.org.springframework.boot=ERROR
logging.level.org.springframework.web=ERROR
spring.main.banner-mode=OFF
spring.datasource.driverClassName=org.h2.Driver
spring.datasource.url=${DB_URL}
spring.datasource.username=${DB_USERNAME}
spring.datasource.password=${DB_PASSWORD}
spring.jpa.database-platform=org.hibernate.dialect.H2Dialect
spring.h2.console.enabled=true
spring.jpa.show-sql=true
spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update
Code.CopyCode:
spring.application.name=demo
logging.level.root=OFF
logging.level.org.springframework.boot=ERROR
logging.level.org.springframework.web=ERROR
spring.main.banner-mode=OFF
spring.datasource.driverClassName=org.h2.Driver
spring.datasource.url=${DB_URL}
spring.datasource.username=${DB_USERNAME}
spring.datasource.password=${DB_PASSWORD}
spring.jpa.database-platform=org.hibernate.dialect.H2Dialect
spring.h2.console.enabled=true
spring.jpa.show-sql=true
spring.jpa.hibernate.ddl-auto=update

Instructions.instruction:
Open your ".env" file in your top-most directory. Note that earlier we added dependencies in the "pom.xml" fle to make the .env file work. Spring Boot doesn't have built-in support for .env files. These credentials are for your H2 database. We're putting them in a .env file so that your secrets don't get pushed to GitHub.

â€¢ Replace "YOUR_USERNAME_HERE" with the username you want to use.
â€¢Â Replace "YOUR_PASSWORD_HERE" with the password you want to use.

I'd recommend keeping them simple. Also if part of your "DB_URL" variable is grayed out it's fine.

This step is completely optional and I do NOT recommend doing it this way. But if you don't want your data to persist between sessions change the "DB_URL" line in the ".env" file to be the following value. This will clear your table everytime you rerun your API. If you choose to do this, remember to use "jdbc:h2:mem:testdb" as your JDBC URL when you login to your h2-console later on.
Now open your ".gitignore" file that's found in the top-most directory of your project. At the very bottom of the file add the following comment and path.
Open your "system.properties" file in the top-most directory of your project. Paste the following line into the file.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> models and then open the "User.java" file. Paste in the following code.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> repositories and then open the "UserRepository.java" file. Paste in the following code.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> services and then open the "UserService.java" file. Paste in the following code.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> controllers and then open the "UserController.java" file. Paste in the following code.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> config and then open the "WebConfig.java" file. Paste in the following code.
Go to src -> main -> java/com/springbackend/demo -> config and then open the "H2ServerConfiguration.java" file. Paste in the following code.

In your terminal run the following commands. You could also change into "spring-boot-h2" then run "npm init" and fill in the prompts to create "package.json", but we'll do it the more straight forward way for now.

Code.FormatCode:
cd ~
cd spring-boot-h2
touch package.json
touch start.sh
Code.CopyCode:
cd ~
cd spring-boot-h2
touch package.json
touch start.sh

Instructions.instruction: Now open your "start.sh" file in the top-most directory of your "spring-boot-h2" folder and paste in the following code.

Code.FormatCode:
#!/bin/sh
YELLOW='\033[0;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

stop_spring_boot() {
  echo "\n\n${YELLOW}Spring Boot application finished successfully!${NC}"
  kill "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"
}

trap stop_spring_boot INT TERM

mvn --quiet spring-boot:run &
SPRING_BOOT_PID=$!

sleep 0.1

echo "* Running on ${BLUE}http://localhost:8080${NC}\n"

wait "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"
Code.CopyCode:
#!/bin/sh
YELLOW='\033[0;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

stop_spring_boot() {
	echo "\n\n${YELLOW}Spring Boot application finished successfully!${NC}"
	kill "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"
}

trap stop_spring_boot INT TERM

mvn --quiet spring-boot:run &
SPRING_BOOT_PID=$!

sleep 0.1

echo "* Running on ${BLUE}http://localhost:8080${NC}\n"

wait "$SPRING_BOOT_PID"

Instructions.instruction: Now open the "package.json" file in the top-most directory. Paste in the following data. Change the value of the "author" attribute to be your name.
Go to your terminal and run the following commands. This will make your shell script an executable. You only have to do this one time.

Run your API using the following command. Note that in your project a new folder called "data" will automatically be created. This folder contains your database file. The folder allows the data in your table to be saved when you stop running your REST API. Note: you won't be able to view the contents of your "demo_db.mv.db" file in VSCode. You'll have to view them using SQL queries in the h2-console later on.
If you get an error saying port 8080 is already in use run the following. Replace "<PID>" with the PID from the first commands output.
Now open the following link in your browser. We're going to query the database in the h2-console. Give it a second to load and try refreshing the page if it says "This site can't be reached".

Keep the link open in your browser, but go back to your folder in VSCode. Open the ".env" file that you created earlier. Copy and record the values of "DB_USERNAME" and "DB_PASSWORD". Then go back to the h2-console in your browser and enter the values into the fields. Then press the "connect" button.

Code.FormatCode:
JDBC URL: jdbc:h2:file:./data/demo_db;DB_CLOSE_ON_EXIT=FALSE;AUTO_RECONNECT=TRUE
User Name: Value of DB_USERNAME
Password: Value of DB_PASSWORD
Code.CopyCode:
JDBC URL: jdbc:h2:file:./data/demo_db;DB_CLOSE_ON_EXIT=FALSE;AUTO_RECONNECT=TRUE
User Name: Value of DB_USERNAME
Password: Value of DB_PASSWORD

Instructions.instruction: Keep both the h2-console and the terminal that's running your localhost open, but open a second terminal. In the second terminal run the following command.

Now go back to your h2-console and run the following SQL query in the input box titled "SQL statement:". Then press the "Run" button above it. There should now be a user named "Jimmy Page" with an id of 1 in the table.
If it's working, you can close all of your terminals, h2-console, VSCode windows, etc.

If you want to change your h2 database username and password you have two options. Steps 25-26 are the first option. Steps 27-29 are the second option. If you don't want to change your username and password, you can ignore these steps and move to the section.

Info.title: Change an H2 Users Credentials
Info.desc: This section is optional and explains how to change a users username and password.

Instructions.instruction: If you don't want to change your H2 username and password skip to the section titled "Setup React Frontend for this Project".

If you want to change your h2 database username and password you have two options. Steps 3-4 are the first option. Steps 5-12 are the second option. Steps 5-7 also explain how to create and grant a new user access to your database.
This is the first option. Delete your current database files from your Spring Boot application. WARNING: This will delete all your saved data.

Code.FormatCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
rm data/demo_db.mv.db
rm data/demo_db.trace.db
Code.CopyCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
rm data/demo_db.mv.db
rm data/demo_db.trace.db

Instructions.instruction: Go to your ".env" file and change the values of DB_USERNAME and DB_PASSWORD to your new credentials. Then rerun your API.

This is the second option. Run your Rest API, then open the h2-console link in your browser. It might take the h2-console site a second to load. Sign in using your current credentials. You can keep your old data using this method.

Code.FormatCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
npm run start

Open this link: http://localhost:8080/h2-console
Code.CopyCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
npm run start

Open this link: http://localhost:8080/h2-console

Instructions.instruction:
In the H2-console first create a new user using the following SQL command.

â€¢Â Replace "new_username" with your new username.
â€¢Â Replace the string 'new_password' with your new password.

Copy and record these values to put in the .env file later. Press the "Run" button to run your query.
Grant all privileges to the new user. Replace "new_username" with the new_username from the last step.

Code.FormatCode: GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA PUBLIC TO new_username;
Code.CopyCode: GRANT ALL ON SCHEMA PUBLIC TO new_username;

Instructions.instruction: Revoke privileges from the old user. Replace "old_username" with your old username.

Code.FormatCode: REVOKE ALL ON SCHEMA PUBLIC FROM old_username;
Code.CopyCode: REVOKE ALL ON SCHEMA PUBLIC FROM old_username;

Instructions.instruction: Grant the user admin rights so you can delete users. Replace "new_username" with your new username.
Now go back to your ".env" file. Replace the DB_USERNAME and DB_PASSWORD with the new credentials from step 6.
Run your Rest API, then open the h2-console link in your browser. Try signing in with your new credentials.

Code.FormatCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
npm run start

Open this link: http://localhost:8080/h2-console
Code.CopyCode:
cd spring-boot-h2
npm run start

Open this link: http://localhost:8080/h2-console

Instructions.instruction: Drop the old user. Replace "old_username" with your old username. You're doing this now since you can't delete the user that's logged in.
Run the folowing SQL command to view all your H2 database users. You shouldn't see your old username in the table.
If you want to revoke a users admin rights, run the following command. Replace "username" with the username of the user you want to revoke the admin privilege of.

Info.title: Setup React Frontend for this Project
Info.desc: Explains how to write the React frontend and connect it to the backend REST API and database.

Instructions.instruction: In the very first step you created a folder called "react-spring-frontend". Change into that folder and download axios.
In the src folder create an axios instance file.

Now open your "react-spring-frontend" folder in VSCode. Paste the following code into the "axiosInstance.js" file in the "src" folder. Note that having a baseURL with an incorrect localhost link can lead to CORS issues. Keep this in mind for the future if you're not using port 8080 for your Rest API. If you've followed all the steps so far you shouldn't have to worry about CORS issues. The port was set to 8080 in the Shell Script.
Got to src -> styles -> views and open "Home.css". Delete its contents and paste in the following code.
Now go to src -> views and open the "Home.jsx" file. Delete its contents and paste in the following code.
Now open two new terminals. In the first terminal run the following commands to start your Rest API. Do not close this terminal.

Open the h2-console link in your browser. It might take a second to load. Sign in using the credentials from your "application.properties" file. This file can found in your "spring-boot-h2" folder in src -> main -> resources. The credentials are the values of the "spring.datasource.username" and "spring.datasource.password" attributes. Press the "Connect" button when you're done.
Now in your second terminal run the following command to start your development server.
Now open the link that was output from the "npm run dev" command in your broswer. It might be the following link.
Practice adding users to your database using your React frontend. Run the following SQL query in your h2-console to see the users you're adding.
Use the following command to delete a user from your table. You can change the WHERE condition to delete by lastname and id as well.
You've finished all the steps and should now have a functioning React app with a Spring Boot backend!
